message.content:
cs.CR, cs.IR, cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.SE 

This paper discusses the use of blockchain technology for security and privacy in IoT platforms, which falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR). The paper also proposes a machine learning-based access control framework, which could be categorized under information retrieval (cs.IR) and networking and internet architecture (cs.NI). The focus on resource-constrained IoT devices suggests a possible category of distributed, parallel, and cluster computing (cs.DC). Finally, the paper discusses threat models and access control issues, which could be categorized under software engineering (cs.SE).
